channel.title: How to run a .JAR File from a Button off a client?
channel.description: This is more RSPS related, more in general, and for future reference, I want to know how to execute a .JAR file. If someone provided me with a snippet I would understand it pretty quick. Thanks! :D

item.title: How to run a .JAR File from a Button off a client?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote="_s, post:4, topic:441658"][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=544349.msg3990217#msg3990217 date=1336478884]
Ripped this from a topic over at mitb but this snippet showed me what I needed to know back when me and you were working on Mythscape and I made the launcher.

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.io.File;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLClassLoader;
import java.util.HashMap;

import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JPopupMenu;

public class RSLoader extends javax.swing.JFrame implements
                java.applet.AppletStub {
        private static final HashMap<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();

        public RSLoader() {
                try {
                        setResizable(false);
                        setTitle("Runescape Loader ~ The Bank");
                        setVisible(true);
                        parameters.put("height", "762");
                        parameters.put("width", "503");
                        parameters.put("worldid", "37");
                        parameters.put("members", "0");
                        parameters.put("modewhat", "0");
                        parameters.put("modewhere", "0");
                        parameters.put("safemode", "1");
                        parameters.put("lang", "0");
                        URLClassLoader classLoader = new URLClassLoader(new URL[] { new URL("file:C:/JarLoader/loader.jar") });
                        System.out.println("Reached!");
                        Applet loader = (Applet) classLoader.loadClass("loader").newInstance();
                        loader.setStub(this);
                        loader.init();
                        loader.start();

                        JPopupMenu.setDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled(false);
                        JPanel theGame = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
                        theGame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 560));
                        setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 658));
                        theGame.add(loader);
                        getContentPane().add(loader, BorderLayout.CENTER);
                        setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
                        setSize(769, 531);
                } catch (Exception e) {
                        e.printStackTrace();
                }
        }

        public void appletResize(int width, int height) {
                // TODO Auto-generated method stub

        }

        public final URL getCodeBase() {
                try {
                        return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
                } catch (Exception e) {
                        return null;
                }
        }

        public final URL getDocumentBase() {
                try {
                        return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
                } catch (Exception e) {
                        return null;
                }
        }

        public final String getParameter(String name) {
                return parameters.get(name);
        }

        public final AppletContext getAppletContext() {
                return null;
        }

        public static void main(String[] args) {
                new RSLoader().setVisible(true);
        }
}

[/quote]

fucking rly[/quote]lmao, win.

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a .JAR File from a Button off a client?

                    loader.setStub(this);
                    loader.init();
                    loader.start();

Ripped this from a topic over at mitb but this snippet showed me what I needed to know back when me and you were working on Mythscape and I made the launcher.

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;

import java.net.URL;

                        parameters.put("width", "503");

                        parameters.put("modewhere", "0");
                        parameters.put("safemode", "1");
                        parameters.put("lang", "0");

                        System.out.println("Reached!");
                        Applet loader = (Applet) classLoader.loadClass("loader").newInstance();

                // TODO Auto-generated method stub

        }

        public final URL getCodeBase() {
                try {
                        return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");

                }
        }

        public final URL getDocumentBase() {
